description.narrative:
This is a project to strengthen humanitarian Oxfam and partner capacities, the ultimate objective is to improve the quality of interventions in Niger. It is the fruit of a work of identifying the weaknesses in the work of Oxfam and partners and solutions needed to address them.
Specifically, it is to strengthen the technical capacities of partner organizations and Oxfam in the preparation and management of emergency operations. The main expected result is that Oxfam partner organizations in the humanitarian field are performing.
The project intervention strategy is based on key aspects below:
- The development of skills within Oxfam and partner organizations
In carrying out activities under this action will be sought as much as possible on the expertise available within Oxfam and partner organizations for the realization of certain activities including those of training. - The use of external expertise as necessary: Oxfam will call to external expertise for the realization of training for which it has no competence at her and partner organizations levels. - The inclusion of gender As much as this is possible, it will be taken into account the specific needs of men and women and other specific groups in the implementation of the project activities. The project implementation will be done in close collaboration between Oxfam and partners, including the implementation of responsibility for certain activities entrusted to them.
- Complementarity with the proposed strengthening humanitarian capacity: A strong link will be sought between this project and the humanitarian capacity building project which has received financial support from oxfam Oxfam Novib's Head office. For example, activities such as those related to the strengthening of institutional and organizational capacities that are not included in this project could be included in this project.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novibs main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fund raising, campaigning and advocacy. The Hub Niamey Niger exists since 2006 as a humanitarian field office and since 2012 as the decentralized Country office for Oxfam Novib, dealing with all the development and humanitarian themes like Sustainable livelihoods, Right to Basic services, Humanitarian and resilience interventions, The right to be heard and the right to an Identity, including women's rights and sexual and reproductive health rights. The Country Office in Niger works with local partners to realize the vision of a Niger without poverty

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: no. of local organisations that have the capacity to provide quality humanitarian response according to international standards (sphere and code of conduct) when necessary and has improved its accountability towards the local people
